stepTitle:
The measured enthalpy change for burning ketene (CH₂CO) is ΔH₁ $$=$$ $$-981.1$$ kJ at 25°C.

CH₂CO(g) + $$2$$ O₂(g) → $$2$$ CO₂(g) + H₂O(g)

The enthalpy change for burning methane is ΔH₂ $$=$$ $$-802.3$$ kJ at 25°C.

CH₄(g) + $$2$$ O₂(g) → CO₂(g) + $$2$$ H₂O(g)

Calculate the enthalpy change at 25°C for the following reaction:

$$2$$ CH₄(g) + $$2$$ O₂(g) → CH₂CO(g) + $$3$$ H₂O(g)
stepBody: Compute your answer in kJ to one decimal place.
